alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 3:26PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, Clarendon, south central Sumter and east central Orangeburg Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 326 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Summerton to near Eastern Lake Marion. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Manning, Summerton, Elloree, Alcolu, Santee State Park, Santee Cooper Regional Airport, Santee, Pinewood, Paxville, Vance, Poplar Creek Landing, Rimini, Stumphole Landing, Brogdon, Eautaw Springs, Blounts Landing, Low Falls Landing, St. Paul, Rocks Pond Campground and Marina, and Lakewood. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 96 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
